alert.note: Alert for Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 8:18AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Park County about 12 miles southwest of Cody. The minor flooding caused by an ice jam is impacting areas from the 6Qs road Bridge near StageTrail road, south to just north of the junction of the 6Qs road and Southfork road. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas along the South Fork of the Shoshone River in the areas mentioned above. The river gauge just south of the 6Qs road Bridge near Stagecoach Trail road will fluctuate between 7.5 feet and 9.5 feet over the next several days. Flood stage at this site is 9.5 feet, but minor flooding can occur between 8.5 feet and 9.5 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 AM MST, emergency management reported flooding near the advisory area. - The river will be at the highest levels between 5 PM and 5 AM each day. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
